overview:
Greg Jester is the CFO of House Party. He joined the company in January 2011, and has led successive rounds of external investment and internal operational improvements.

Prior to House Party, Greg spent 13+ years in the pharmaceutical and biotech industries, where he gained broad experience with both large companies and smaller start-ups.

Greg served as VP and Corporate Controller at Barr Pharmaceuticals for 10+ years, leading its finance and accounting functions as the company grew from $200 million to $1.3 billion in revenue. Greg also was CFO at two small start-up pharmaceutical/bio-tech companies, which he joined at inception, establishing the finance, accounting, administration and investor relation functions.

Greg got his start in public accounting at KPMG and also spent time with the CIT Group, providing middle market asset-based lending solutions.

Greg lives in Stamford CT and is an avid swimmer, baseball player, skier and sailor.
